thread.title: Obese men last 1 minute and 30 seconds longer in bed | Metro News
thread.title_full: Obese men last 1 minute and 30 seconds longer in bed | Metro News

author: Nicole Morley For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Obese men last 1 minute and 30 seconds longer in bed | Metro News
text:
Nicole Morley for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 8:21 am (Picture: Getty) 
Being overweight comes with a plethora of complications. 
Heart disease, diabetes and an increased risk of stroke and cancer are all linked to excess weight – but new research suggests there is an unexpected benefit. Haunting pictures show the forgotten starving children of South Sudan 
Experts have claimed that men with excess fat around their stomachs have more stamina in the bedroom. 
In a recent study, obese men were found to last for around one minute and 30 seconds longer than their slimmer peers. (Picture: Getty) 
The research, conducted at Erciyes University in Turkey, suggests there’s a correlation between a man’s physical size and his endurance during sex. 
Overweight men have a heightened level of estradiol, a female sex hormone which inhibits the male orgasm. 
The presence of estradiol mirrors the effects of delay creams, which delay male climax. 
The study, Insight on pathogenesis of lifelong premature ejaculation, also found that men who suffered with lifelong premature ejaculation issues were likely to be slimmer. More
